results.title: Bovine contagious pleuropneumonia
results.brief_description: This film traces the introduction and spread of the disease throughout Australia; why it persists in the north and how in spite of all precautions it occasionally infiltrates to the south. The main section of the film depicts in detail the characteristic symptoms and post-mortem findings, the effectiveness of vaccination, and the nature of present and past research work of the Division of Animal Health and Production.

results.title: Boundary lines
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and Phillip Stapp
results.brief_description: This film is a plea for human understanding of our fellows. Its message is that we must learn, as people, to live together in harmony and tolerance, making every effort to overcome the invisible lines which divide us against each other - lines which spring from fear, greed, hate, and prejudice, the boundary lines of environment, wealth, skin colour, religion, language and racial origin. The technique of this film is of particular interest; conventional animation is used sparingly; for its impact Boundary Lines relies mostly on drawings moved in relation to the camera.

results.title: Boundaries of the heart
results.creator_credit: Patric Juillet, Tra La La Films, FGH Film Consortium and Lex Marinos
results.brief_description: Depicts life in an outback Australian town, centring on a small town belle who has become bitter and stilted. She is alienating her family friends and shearer boyfriend and after many humiliations, she faces a bleak and lonely future. Stars Wendy Hughes, John Hargreaves and Norman Kaye.

results.title: Bound for Botany Bay
results.creator_credit: Jonathan King, John Dollar and First Fleet Films
results.brief_description: Using re-enactments and contemporary paintings and documents, this program addresses crime and punishment in 18th Century England, reasons for the colonisation of Australia, the fitting and sailing of the First Fleet and the arrival at Botany Bay and Port Jackson. The inclusion of a re-enactment of this arrival performed in modern Sydney, includes Aborigines protesting about the loss of their land rights. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Bound [DVD]
results.creator_credit: De Laurentiis Entertainment Group, Andrew Lazar, Stuart Boros, Andy Wachowski and Larry Wachowski
results.brief_description: A stylish and sexy noir thriller directed by the Wachowski Brothers. Corky (Gina Gershon) has just finished a stint in the slammer, and has been hired to renovate the apartment next door to Caeser (Joe Pantoliano), and his vampish girlfriend, Violet (Jennifer Tilly). Violet pursues Corky and they have an affair, which leads to them plotting to steal two million dollars of stashed Mafia money currently in Caeser’s custody. Can they pull off this daring theft, or will an unexpected twist in their otherwise flawless plan lead to their downfall?

results.title: Bound
results.creator_credit: Daniella Ortega, Serhat Caradee and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A boy, a dead body, a relentless pursuit – it’s not what you see, it’s how you see it.
Bound is an urban tragedy about a boy who is mistakenly shot by the police. Jumping back and forth in time to reveal instincts colliding and lives unravelling in a world that rushes on regardless, this film is about what happens when you make all the wrong decisions for the right reasons.

results.title: Boudu Sauve des Eaux = Boudu Saved from Drowning
results.creator_credit: Michel Simon, Jean Gehret and Jean Renoir
results.brief_description:
Boudu, a rambling tramp, is taken into the middle-class household of a Parisian book seller after being rescued from the Seine. Boudu shows scant regard for bourgeois decorum. The humour is gently satirical and subversive rather than cutting, but is far from the original play’s affirmation of middle-class culture. Renoir’s use of long takes, camera movement, depth of field in loosely framed compositions with the continuous suggestion of a world beyond the frame, was the antithesis of the then developing Hollywood style of tight compositions and reverse angle cutting. Re-made as ‘Down and out in Beverly Hills’ by Paul Mazursky (1986). Further reading: Richard Boston. ‘Boudu saved from drowning’. London: BFI Publishing, 1994.

Credits: Producer, Jean Gehret, Michel Simon ; director, Jean Renoir ; writers, Jean Renoir, Robert Valentin ; photography, Marcel Lucien, George Asselin ; music, Raphael, Johann Strauss ; editor, Marguerite Houlle-Renoir, Suzanne de Troeye ; assistan
Cast: Michel Simon, Charles Granval, Marcelle Haina, Severine Lerczynska, Max Dalban, Jean Gehret, Jean Daste, Jacques Becker, Jane Pierson.

results.title: Bouddi
results.brief_description: A camera calligraphy of the coastal bush at Bouddi, NSW. This film springs from a strong attachment to the Australian bush landscape, an echo of the spirit of kinship that imbued the life of the Aboriginal tribes. The film is a camera calligraphy moving through the bush, capturing textures, surfaces, shadows and light, details of foliage and expanses of rocks and trees, insects and birds - it sees the bush in much the same way as Aboriginal hunters may have seen it, moving rapidly through it. The complexity of the images is repeated in the Aboriginal music, visuals and sounds forming a rhythmic pattern.
